questions: What is a block level element?
answer: An element always starts on a new line, and the browsers automatically add some space (a margin) before and after the element.

questions: What is a block level element?
answer: An element that does not start on a new line, and only takes up as much space as necessary.

questions: What is the <span> element used for?
answer: It is used inline within a container to wrap part of a text or the document with its own specific attributes, styles, classes and id's.

questions: What is the class attribute used for?
answer: It is used to point to a class name in a style sheet such as CSS or SCSS.

questions: Is the class name case sensitive?
answer: Yes, class name's are case sensitive.

questions: What is the id attribute used for?
answer: It is used to specify a unique id for an HTML element.

questions: How many times an id attributes be used?
answer: Id's can only be used once.

questions: True or False: id attributes are only HTML specific?
answer: False, they can also be used within javascript, and other frameworks/libraries.

questions: How are id's referenced within a CSS style sheet?
answer: It is referenced by using a #.

questions: Is the # a reserved key within HTML?
answer: No, it is only reserved within CSS.

questions: What is the difference between a class and an id?
answer: A class name can be used by multiple HTML elements, while an id name must only be used by one HTML element within the page.

questions: True or False: the id attribute within HTML is accessible within Javascript?
answer: True, id can be accessed by DOM manipulation.

questions: True or False: the <iframe> tag specifies an inline frame?
answer: True

questions: True or False: It is best practice to not include the title attribute within <iframe>?
answer: False, it is best practice to always include the title attribute.

questions: What is the main use of a <select> tag?
answer: It creates a drop down menu.

questions: True of False: <iframe> tags allow for inline styling?
answer: True

questions: What does XHTML stand for?
answer: EXtensible HyperText Markup Language.

questions: Is HTML or XHTML more strict?
answer: XHTML.

questions: What is XHTML?
answer: XHTML is a stricter, more XML-based version of HTML.

questions: True of False: XHTML is supported by all major browsers?
answer: True

questions: True or False: <!DOCTYPE> is mandatory within XHTML?
answer: True

questions: True or False: XHTML elements must always be closed?
answer: True

questions: What is the <svg> tag used for?
answer: It is used for SVG graphics.

questions: True or False: SVG's are imported image specific?
answer: False

questions: What is the difference between SVG and canvas?
answer: SVG is a language for describing 2D graphics in XML. Canvas draws 2D graphics.

questions: What tag is used for videos within HTML?
answer: <video>.
